channel.title: HOME on AbdoulKaled
channel.description: Recent content in HOME on AbdoulKaled

item.title: California House Price Prediction
item.description: Build a model of housing prices to predict median house values in California using the provided dataset. Train the model to learn from the data to predict the median housing price in any district, given all the other metrics. Predict housing prices based on median_income and plot the regression chart for it. Link to GitHub

item.title: Text Mining FIFAWorldCup2018
item.description: Python functions that accept a string and return N most frequent nouns (Take function name as “GetNMostFrequentNouns”) N most frequent verbs (Take function name as “GetNMostFrequentVerbs”) N most frequent delimiters (Take function name as “GetNMostFrequentDelimiters”) N most frequent prepositions (Take function name as “GetNMostFrequentPrepositions”) Run all the functions on the file “FIFAWorldCup2018.txt” and print the results. Python function that accepts a string and prints the first sentence in the string along with its syntax tree.

item.title: Car Evaluation
item.description: Predict the condition of a vehicle based on its features. Plot the most important features. Train multiple classifiers and compare the accuracy. Evaluate the XGBoost model with K-fold cross-validation. Link to GitHub

item.title: Amazon Employee
item.description: Create a tool that predict the accuracy of the access status to certain resources of employees. Auto-access models seek to minimize human involvement. Link to GitHub

item.title: Health Insurance Cost
item.description: Find the correlation of every pair of features (and the outcome variable). Visualize the correlations using a heatmap. Normalize the inputs. Use the test data to find out the accuracy of the model. Visualize how the model uses the different features and which features have a greater effect.

item.title: Manage Your Menu
item.description: Menu in the sidebar can be defined within the config.toml or directly in the files. I prefer the config file approach, as this menu is pretty simple.

You can use it as a base for your website.

item.title: Open Graph image
item.description: Within any page, you can add in the FrontMatter a images array that will be used to define a specific Open Graph image. For example, see content/_index.md page:
